thread.title: These tote bags will help you carry your books in style
thread.title_full: These tote bags will help you carry your books in style

author: Marty Preciado
title: These tote bags will help you carry your books in style
text:
These tote bags will help you carry your books in style Thanks to digital books and tablets, it has become much easier to carry our books, and large collections of literary works are no longer impossible to take with you. However, if you lean towards the traditional , physical copies of books are still an option for those in love with the smell or the sensation of rubbing fingers against pages while reading.
Jorge Luis Borges said, “I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library,” and we agree with him — but in order to stack our own Paradise, we need help carrying our books. Let’s start with tote bags.
Wearing a tote bags is like being in a secret club. Tote bags are an expression of our unique voices and interests. Through them, we silently tell the world who we are and what we believe — plus they help us carry books and our daily needs.
Style aside, we can carry a message, too. A tote bag can be a perfect way to support our local bookstores or local artists.
Although we wish we could carry an entire Paradise in our hands, we can definitely carry some books thanks to these.
1. Printed Matter, Inc. This tote bag designed by Benjamin Critton for Printed Matter, a non-profit organization based in New York dedicated to showcasing artists. The tote bag boasts a powerful message: BOOKS IS POWER.
BOOKS IS POWER tote bag exists once again (here, digitally) in new cream/tan on black colorway courtesy @benjamincritton @okbaggu 
A post shared by Printed Matter, Inc. (@printedmatterinc) on Mar 11, 2017 at 10:39am PST 
We agree, knowledge is power, and books, too.
2. Literary Hub Literary Hub is a one-stop shop for all your needs. To celebrate books and literary culture, you can carry all your belongings and books in one of the tote bags beautifully graced by Joan Didion. Best thing about this tote bag: IT’S FREE.
#LitHub #Readtolive #joandidion #wi10 #bestswag 
A post shared by Literary Hub (@literaryhub) on Feb 11, 2015 at 7:42am PST 
To get one, you have to follow Literary Hub across social media verticals and participate in their giveaways.
3. Shakespeare & Co. Shakespeare & Co is an English-language bookshop in Paris — a classic bookstore nestled in the corner of narrowed streets overlooking Notre Dame and the Seine river. The tote bag illustrates the classic shop façade.
Shakespeare & Co 
Gertrude Stein would spend her time at this bookstore!
4. Out of Print From mugs to t-shirts and tote bags, Out of Print is a hub for book-inspired apparel and accessories. One of the many ways to pay tribute to your first love: a library card. Out of Print has a library card tote bag that is a classic must-have.
Out of Print 5. Skylight Books Los Angeles has its own paradise, too. Skylight Books is a hub for talks, gatherings, and books. Also, a dream space: a beautiful tree grows in the middle of the bookstore. Skylight Books has a tote bag highlighting the wonder of its store.
6. City Lights Bookstore More than a bookstore, it’s a landmark. City Lights is a bookstore that has helped shape culture. It is a space for people to gather, read, and be informed. Its tote bag pictures the iconic storefront in San Francisco.
City Lights 7. Masa It’s not necessarily a bookstore, but Masa has tote bags created by Colombian designers and artists. As an allusion to the Colombian peace treaty, Masa released a tote bag reading: if we have peace, we’re great; with a play on words about peace and bread .
lo perfecto es enemigo de lo bueno… #sihaypazestamosbien ✌ ️ 
A post shared by Si hay pan, estamos bien. (@somosmasa) on Sep 26, 2016 at 12:04pm PDT 

Grab your tote bag and join the secret club of your choice!
